title: 'Kante facts' sadly dispelled by France and Chelsea star
text:
0 21 Mar 2017 18:13:15 The Blues midfielder is not getting carried away by the hype surrounding him following his stellar performances for the Premier League leaders 
Can N'Golo Kante touch MC Hammer? Can he get a retweet on Facebook? Does he cover the 29 per cent of Earth that is not water? 
Sadly, he cannot. But it has not stopped the social-media sensation that is 'Kante facts' keeping Chelsea's squad entertained in recent weeks. 
Deschamps: Kante one of world's best 
The France midfielder is set for a second Premier League title in as many seasons, having powered Leicester City's charge to glory last season before moving to Stamford Bridge. 
Les Bleus legend Marcel Desailly has been quick to jump on the bandwagon, but Kante will not let his reported superpowers go to his head as he returns to international duty against Luxembourg and France. 71% of the earth is covered by water. The remaining 29% is covered by N'Golo Kanté @ChelseaFC Hahahahahahha — Marcel Desailly (@marceldesailly) March 14, 2017 
"I am really happy with my performances this season," Kante said at a media conference. 
"It is true that I receive a lot of praise and that is flattering. But I try not to let it affect me. The important thing is to end the season well. 
Kante: I don't feel like the best 
"My team-mates at Chelsea have told me about the 'Kante-facts'. It is just a bit of fun. I obviously do not cover 30 per cent of the surface of the earth. 
"I made the right choice to come to Chelsea. We are in a good position and we are playing some great football." 
Kante has also addressed Claudio Ranieri’s exit from the managerial post at Leicester. 
The Italian was relieved of his duties in February after seeing title celebrations with the Foxes make way for a relegation scrap. 
'Kante's not all he's cracked up to be' 
His departure sparked intense debate regarding snap judgements in modern football, but Kante believes his legacy will live on at the King Power Stadium. 
"It's sad after what happened last year, after the title and what happened in the football world in England,” he said. 
“I think in the end that these are things that happen. The club made that decision but we cannot take away what Claudio Ranieri did at Leicester.” Related
